channel.title: Problem with doorhandler
channel.description: I got a fairly empty source that i thought would be good to start my first good server, but it didn't come with a door handler. I borrowed the doorhandler.class and doorhandler.java files from another source i already had, added the appropriate codes into the server.java and client.java, tried to compile and i still have 1 last error that i can't seem to figure out...this is what my compiler says: [code]Compiling..... client.java:970: ReplaceObject(int,int,int,int) in client cannot be applied to ( int,int,int,int,int) ReplaceObject(server.doorHandler.doorX[d], ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 1 error Compiling Finished. Press any key to continue . . .[/code] Can anyone help me out? Please pm me

item.title: Problem with doorhandler
item.dc:creator: @warrsaw warrsaw
item.description:
@warrsaw wrote:

I got a fairly empty source that i thought would be good to start my first good server, but it didn’t come with a door handler. I borrowed the doorhandler.class and doorhandler.java files from another source i already had, added the appropriate codes into the server.java and client.java, tried to compile and i still have 1 last error that i can’t seem to figure out…this is what my compiler says:

Compiling..... client.java:970: ReplaceObject(int,int,int,int) in client cannot be applied to ( int,int,int,int,int) ReplaceObject(server.doorHandler.doorX[d], ^ Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 1 error Compiling Finished. Press any key to continue . . .
Can anyone help me out? Please pm me

Read full topic
